Class MazePlay

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              MazePlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener
public class MazePlay
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener

Program to display and solve mazes. Takes input from files in the maze file format or generates (and optionally saves) random mazes.

MazePlay takes as its first command-line argument either a switch that indicates that it should generate a random maze or a switch that indicates that it should open a saved maze file. See the main() method for more information. Regardless of the switch used, MazePlay opens a window and draws the maze.

MazePlay contains code to manage a computer maze solver. To start the solver, click anywhere in the maze window. The window will display the number of forward and backward steps, and the position of the solver will be shown in the maze. The solver can be suspended and resumed by clicking in the window.

You will have to implement the logic for the solver, but the logic for controlling the solver thread (via mouse clicking) has already been implemented. The solver code and the data structure for storing the maze is contained in the class Maze, so the source code for MazePlay should not be modified.

You can close any window at any time. The program should end when all its windows close (although there is no explicit action to indicate this). Closing a window will kill that window's solver thread.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getState

public int getState(int row,
                    int col)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Indicates a cell's traversal state (for use with the solver). Traversal state gets set by setState(), to be used by the solver.

Parameters:
row - row number (vertical coordinate) of the cell whose state is being queried
col - column number (horizontal coordinate) of the cell whose state is being queried
Returns:
MazePlay.E if the cell has not been visited; MazePlay.F if the cell has been visited in the forward direction; MazePlay.B if the cell has been visited during backtracking
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if col < 0, row < 0, col > = width, or row >= height

visited

public boolean visited(int row,
                       int col)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Indicates a cell's traversal state (for use with the solver). Traversal state gets set by setState(), to be used by the solver. Shorthand for (getState(row, col) != MazePlay.E).

Parameters:
row - row number (vertical coordinate) of the cell whose state is being queried
col - column number (horizontal coordinate) of the cell whose state is being queried
Returns:
true if the cell has been visited (MazePlay.F or MazePlay.B); false if the cell has not been visited (MazePlay.E
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if col < 0, row < 0, col > = width, or row >= height

setState

public boolean setState(int row,
                        int col,
                        int v)
                 throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                        java.lang.ThreadDeath
Sets the solver-traversal state of a maze cell. Also maintains thread control for the solver.

Parameters:
row - row number (vertical coordinate) of the cell whose state is being changed
col - column number (horizontal coordinate) of the cell whose state is being changed
v - MazePlay.F to indicate forward traversal; MazePlay.B to indicate backwards traversal; MazePlay.E (or other value) to indicate unvisited (empty)
Returns:
true if the cell state is changed by this call; false if the cell state is not changed (either v is an unrecognized state or the state of the cell is already v)
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if col < 0, row < 0, col > = width, or row >= height
java.lang.ThreadDeath - if the solver thread has been killed

run

public void run()
Thread to create a window to display the maze. Assumes a MazePlay object has been initialized to contain the maze to display.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Starts the MazePlay program.

Usage:

  • java MazePlay -r rows cols [filename]
    Generates a random maze with dimensions rows x cols (the width is cols and the height is rows). If filename is provided, the maze will be saved as the given filename in addition to being opened in a window.
  • java MazePlay -f filename
    Reads the maze data from the given filename and displays the maze in a window.

Parameters:
args - Command-line arguments following usage instructions described above.
